diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: Politician. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: battle - Example triple: (Aaron S. Daggett | battle | American Civil War)
Predicate: birthPlace - Example triple: (Aaron S. Daggett | birthPlace | Greene, Maine)
Predicate: deathPlace - Example triple: (Aaron S. Daggett | deathPlace | Massachusetts)
Predicate: almaMater - Example triple: (Ab Klink | almaMater | Erasmus University Rotterdam)
Predicate: birthDate - Example triple: (Ab Klink | birthDate | 1958-11-02)
Predicate: nationality - Example triple: (Ab Klink | nationality | Netherlands)
Predicate: office - Example triple: (Ab Klink | office | "Member of the House of Representatives")
Predicate: party - Example triple: (Ab Klink | party | Christian Democratic Appeal)
Predicate: hasDeputy - Example triple: (Abdul Rahman Ya'kub | hasDeputy | Stephen Yong Kuet Tze)
Predicate: region - Example triple: (Abdul Taib Mahmud | region | Asajaya)
Predicate: residence - Example triple: (Abdul Taib Mahmud | residence | "Demak Jaya, Jalan Bako, Kuching, Sarawak")
Predicate: successor - Example triple: (Abdul Taib Mahmud | successor | Abdul Rahman Ya'kub)
Predicate: country - Example triple: (Abdulsalami Abubakar | country | Nigeria)
Predicate: inOfficeWhileVicePresident - Example triple: (Abdulsalami Abubakar | inOfficeWhileVicePresident | Mike Akhigbe)
Predicate: militaryBranch - Example triple: (Abdulsalami Abubakar | militaryBranch | Nigerian Air Force)
Predicate: inOfficeWhilePrimeMinister - Example triple: (Abel Caballero | inOfficeWhilePrimeMinister | Felipe González)
Predicate: inOfficeWhilePresident - Example triple: (Abraham A. Ribicoff | inOfficeWhilePresident | John F. Kennedy)
Predicate: spouse - Example triple: (Abraham A. Ribicoff | spouse | "Ruth Ribicoff")
Predicate: activeYearsStartDate - Example triple: (Adam Holloway | activeYearsStartDate | 2005-05-05)
Predicate: numberOfVotesAttained - Example triple: (Adam Holloway | numberOfVotesAttained | 9312)
Predicate: award - Example triple: (Adam Koc | award | Cross of Independence)
Predicate: activeYearsEndDate - Example triple: (Airey Neave | activeYearsEndDate | 1979-03-30)
Predicate: unit - Example triple: (Airey Neave | unit | Royal Artillery)
Predicate: birthYear - Example triple: (Albert B. White | birthYear | 1856)
Predicate: deathDate - Example triple: (Albert B. White | deathDate | 1941-07-03)
Predicate: deathYear - Example triple: (Albert B. White | deathYear | 1941)
Predicate: profession - Example triple: (Albert B. White | profession | Politician)
Predicate: religion - Example triple: (Alvah Sabin | religion | Baptists)
Predicate: commander - Example triple: (American Civil War | commander | Abraham Lincoln)
Predicate: language - Example triple: (Argentina | language | Spanish language)
Predicate: officialLanguage - Example triple: (Argentina | officialLanguage | Spanish language)
Predicate: leader - Example triple: (Austria | leader | Doris Bures)
Predicate: isPartOfMilitaryConflict - Example triple: (Battle of Antietam | isPartOfMilitaryConflict | American Civil War)
Predicate: governingBody - Example triple: (Buenos Aires | governingBody | Buenos Aires City Legislature)
Predicate: affiliation - Example triple: (Erasmus University Rotterdam | affiliation | Association of MBAs)

responses:
Here's an improvement suggestion focusing on handling multiple triples more cohesively, especially for relationships like country and capital, and to reduce repetition:

```diff
<<<<<<< SEARCH
            elif triple.predicate == "country":
                sentence += f"{triple.subject} is from {triple.object}. "
            elif triple.predicate == "capital":
                sentence += f"{triple.subject} is the capital of {triple.object}. "
=======
            elif triple.predicate == "country":
                country = triple.object
                capital_info = next((t for t in triples if t.predicate == "capital" and t.subject == country), None)
                if capital_info:
                    sentence += f"{triple.subject} is a country where {capital_info.object} is the capital. "
                else:
                    sentence += f"{triple.subject} is located in {triple.object}. "
            elif triple.predicate == "capital":
                # Handled in country predicate
                pass
>>>>>>> REPLACE
```
Explanation:

The original code treated "country" and "capital" as independent triples, potentially leading to disjointed sentences. The improved code attempts to link them. When a "country" triple is encountered, it searches for a corresponding "capital" triple related to that country within the *entire* list of triples.  If a capital is found, it constructs a sentence that combines the information.  The capital predicate is skipped to avoid redundancy. This is likely to produce more coherent and natural-sounding sentences. It also addresses the prompt's request for more complex sentence structures.
